name: SelectRoot
description: Root component of Select that manages the selection state and provides context. Renders a `<div>` element.

props.name: actionsRef
props.description:
A ref to imperative actions.
- `unmount`: When specified, the select will not be unmounted when closed.
Instead, the `unmount` function must be called to unmount the select manually.
Useful when the select's animation is controlled by an external library.

props.name: defaultOpen
props.description:
Whether the select popup is initially open.

To render a controlled select popup, use the `open` prop instead.

props.name: defaultValue
props.description:
The uncontrolled value of the select when it’s initially rendered.

To render a controlled select, use the `value` prop instead.

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether the component should ignore user interaction.

props.name: highlightItemOnHover
props.description:
Whether moving the pointer over items should highlight them.
Disabling this prop allows CSS `:hover` to be differentiated from the `:focus` (`data-highlighted`) state.

props.name: id
props.description: The id of the Select.

props.name: inputRef
props.description: A ref to access the hidden input element.

props.name: isItemEqualToValue
props.description:
Custom comparison logic used to determine if a select item value matches the current selected value. Useful when item values are objects without matching referentially.
Defaults to `Object.is` comparison.

props.name: items
props.description:
Data structure of the items rendered in the select popup.
When specified, `<Select.Value>` renders the label of the selected item instead of the raw value.

props.name: itemToStringLabel
props.description:
When the item values are objects (`<Select.Item value={object}>`), this function converts the object value to a string representation for display in the trigger.
If the shape of the object is `{ value, label }`, the label will be used automatically without needing to specify this prop.

props.name: itemToStringValue
props.description:
When the item values are objects (`<Select.Item value={object}>`), this function converts the object value to a string representation for form submission.
If the shape of the object is `{ value, label }`, the value will be used automatically without needing to specify this prop.

props.name: modal
props.description:
Determines if the select enters a modal state when open.
- `true`: user interaction is limited to the select: document page scroll is locked and pointer interactions on outside elements are disabled.
- `false`: user interaction with the rest of the document is allowed.

props.name: name
props.description: Identifies the field when a form is submitted.

props.name: onOpenChange
props.description: Event handler called when the select popup is opened or closed.

props.name: onOpenChangeComplete
props.description: Event handler called after any animations complete when the select popup is opened or closed.

props.name: onValueChange
props.description: Event handler called when the value of the select changes.

props.name: open
props.description: Whether the select popup is currently open.

props.name: readOnly
props.description: Whether the user should be unable to choose a different option from the select popup.

props.name: render
props.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.

props.name: required
props.description: Whether the user must choose a value before submitting a form.

props.name: value
props.description: The value of the select. Use when controlled.

props.name: invalid
props.description: Determines whether the Select is in an invalid state.

props.name: size
props.description: Determines the size of the Select trigger.
